oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: The Bama Band - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews the Bama Band (musicial group). The episode was set to air on an unidentified date. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Bama Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Bama Band Pulsebeat show -- (00:42) Love With a Southern Accent (Bama Band) -- (03:56) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (04:01) Dial 901 [unconfirmed] ([Unidentified]) -- (05:09) Spangler reflects on how Hank Williams Jr. created the Bama Band; additionally, Wayne Turner reflects on Williams Jr.'s pride in the band -- (06:58) Spangler asks Turner what's the craziest thing that's happened to him on stage -- (07:36) A Real Old Fashioned Love Song (Bama Band) -- (10:47) Spangler greets the various radio stations hosting the show -- (11:18) Spangler reflects on Hank Williams Jr.'s rising popularity; additionally, Turner reflects on what it is like to tour with Williams Jr.-- (12:20) When We Get Back to the Farm (Hank Williams Jr. and the Bama Band) -- (16:03) Spangler introduces the various personalities that make up the Bama Band; additionally, Turner reflects on the nickname 'Animal' -- (16:53) High school Buddies (Bama Band) -- (20:08) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (20:28) Spangler asks Turner what song he wished to hear -- (20:38) 80's Ladies (K. T. Oslin) -- (24:38) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; The Bama Band (Musical group);
